intro: Utricularia humboldtii f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant features specialized bladder-like structures that trap and digest small aquatic organisms. Its flowers are typically white or pale in color, contributing to its common name. This variety is notable for its unique adaptations to nutrient-poor water environments.
